examples: Its meetings have long ceased, and it is only fair to hope that there be none of the young and gay spirits of Glasgow eager to revive so palpable a gegg as the one we have just recorded,  [â€¦]

verbs.description: gegg (third-person singular simple present geggs, present participle gegging, simple past and past participle gegged)

entries.meaning: (Scotland, archaic, transitive) To trick or hoax.
